intro: Cyclophyllum novoguineensis, commonly known as the New Guinea cyclophyllum, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Malvaceae. It is native to the tropical regions of New Guinea and is characterized by its distinctive palmate leaves and showy, yellowish flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Its fruits are capsule-like structures that contain several seeds, which are dispersed by wind. Cyclophyllum novoguineensis is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and ecological adaptations in its native habitat.
